hero.title: What is Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) and why is it key to operational efficiency?
hero.subtitle: Modern organizations increasingly rely on documents to operate: contracts, invoices, legal files, forms, reports, and critical records. However, much of this information is still processed manually, resulting in high operational costs, slow response times, and increased risk of error.
hero.intro: In this context, Intelligent Document Processing (IDP) has become a strategic capability. It involves not just digitizing documents, but extracting, structuring, and leveraging information to improve business decisions, efficiency, and scalability.

whatIsIdp.title: What is Intelligent Document Processing (IDP)?
content: IDP is a technology that combines advanced OCR, artificial intelligence, and language understanding models to process documents automatically and structurally.
Unlike traditional processing, IDP allows you to:
• Identify key data (dates, amounts, entities, clauses)
• Convert complex information into data usable by business systems

whyRelevant.title: Why is IDP relevant for organizations today?
content: The value of IDP goes beyond automation. From a business perspective, it allows you to:
• Reduce operational costs by minimizing repetitive manual tasks.
• Accelerate critical processes such as approvals, reviews, or validations.
• Decrease risks by improving information consistency and traceability.
• Scale operations, even as document volume grows.
According to Gartner, organizations that adopt intelligent automation technologies achieve significant improvements in efficiency and operational control. [1]

technologies.title: What technologies make IDP possible?
technologies.intro: Intelligent document processing relies on several key components:

1.title: 1. Advanced OCR
1.description: Enables the conversion of scanned or digital documents into readable text, even when quality is low or the format is complex.

2.title: 2. Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
2.description: AI models learn to recognize patterns, structures, and relevant fields within different types of documents.

3.title: 3. Natural Language Understanding
3.description: Facilitates the interpretation of content beyond isolated words, understanding context and relationships between data.

technologies.conclusion: According to IBM, combining these technologies is fundamental to transforming documents into information assets. [2]

strategy.title: DocumentoIQ and the Strategic Approach to IDP
strategy.content: At DocumentoIQ, IDP is conceived as a cross-cutting capability designed to integrate into real processes and support critical decisions. It is not just about automating documents, but about enabling operational intelligence from them. This approach allows organizations to move from basic digitization to truly intelligent and scalable document management.
